intro: Erodium botrys var. angustisectum, commonly known as narrow-leafed stormweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered pink or purple flowers. The plant has finely divided, narrow leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and open fields. Its growth habit and floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
